org.omnaest.utils.beans.replicator
Class BeanReplicator

java.lang.Object
  org.omnaest.utils.beans.replicator.BeanReplicator

public class BeanReplicator
extends Object

The BeanReplicator allows to make a deep copy or a deep clone of an Object graph.
For the copy(Object) method the BeanReplicator allows to use one or multiple BeanReplicator.Adapter instances,
whereby the clone(Object) will try to clone the given source object without transformation.

As an example of a source Object take a CGLIB proxy instance implementing some getter and setter methods representing some property methods.
The copy(Object) method allows to create e.g. a data transfer Object which has a complete other Class type, but which gets all the single properties copied one by one.
On the other hand the clone(Object) method would try to create another CGLIB proxy instance which does exactly the same as the original proxy Object but being a new instance.

A good decision hint can be, if the state of objects should be replicated, for example for a history function, the use of clone(Object) should be considered first.
On the other hand for creating data transfer objects (DTOs) the copy(Object) method in conjunction with a given set of BeanReplicator.Adapters is more appropriate most of the time.

The BeanReplicator uses a default BeanReplicator.Configurations.

Author:
Omnaest
See Also:
copy(Object), clone(Object), BeanReplicator.Adapter, BeanReplicator.Configuration

Nested Class Summary
static interface BeanReplicator.Adapter
          Marker interface for all BeanReplicator.Adapter used in combination with the BeanReplicator

An BeanReplicator.Adapter is thread safe and can be reused even by multiple Threads or multiple BeanReplicator instances.
static interface BeanReplicator.AdapterInternal
          Internal extension of the BeanReplicator.Adapter interface which provides a Set of BeanReplicator.AdapterInternal.Handler instances which can be used to copy concrete source objects.
static class BeanReplicator.Configuration
          Configuration of the BeanReplicator
static interface BeanReplicator.TransitiveBeanReplicationInvocationHandler
          Callback for transitive replication invocations through BeanReplicator.Adapter instances

clone

public <E> E clone(E sourceObject)
Clones a given source object. This differs from copy(Object) in the way, that the returned Object will have the same type as the given one. The copy(Object) method uses the BeanReplicator.Adapter instances which allow to generate different type instances containing the same property values as the original given Object instance.

Parameters:
sourceObject -
Returns:
new cloned instance
See Also:
BeanReplicator, copy(Object)
